website_summaries.verdict: Simple to put together and use, the Swiffer’s classic dry sweeper gets top marks. Its wet cloths aren’t in the same class, however.
pros: Users like the inclusion of both dry and wet towels
cons: Towels don't always stay in place, are not effective

website_summaries.verdict: Beloved product that’s lightweight, simple and fast, and doesn’t take up a lot of space.
pros: Owners swear that nothing removes sticky spills, paw prints or footprints better than a Swiffer
This starter kit includes dry cloths that mimic sweeping in addition to wet cloths
Reviewers boast that there are never any streaks or dull finish
No need to fill any buckets or even a spray bottle – cloths are already damp
Base pivots easily to get around furniture and behind toilets
After initial purchase of starter kit, all you need to buy are refill cloths
cons: Some note that Swiffers create waste – dry and wet cloths should be disposed of after every use
However, this is the very feature many people love – no dustpans or brooms to clean and no mop cloths to wash

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and small
customer_reviews.text: I like to use this mop with a washcloth tucked onto the end. I spray my cleaning solution on that and scrub away on the floor. Then just wash all the rags when I finish the whole house. I usually need 1-3 rags per room. Much more eco friendly than disposable covers!
customer_reviews.author: Mike and Rae Cousineau

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: The little wet pads never stay on. And you can't push the mop back and forth without it spinning into the wrong direction or flipping upwards - you can basically only mop in one direction (forward). It's annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Sara K

customer_reviews.title: I love this for cleaning walls & ceilings
customer_reviews.text: Thank you to the reviewer that mentioned you could use this with a rag or paper towels, otherwise I may have never bought this. I love this for cleaning walls & ceilings, it's actually just what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: KaelahTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Starter kit gives opportunity to try both wet and dry types of swiffer cloths
customer_reviews.text: I am glad that I purchased the Swiffer starter kit. I continue to use the dry swiffer pads but found the wet ones to be useless. They are very wet (too wet) for a couple square feet and then are almost dry and do nothing to clean the floor. I cannot even wipe my small entry hall with one of the wet swiffers. The great thing about the starter kit is that I didn't waste my money on a box of wet ones, but got to try them and also learned that the dry ones are very useful - especially for picking up dog hair.
customer_reviews.author: Loves To Cook

customer_reviews.title: It is very flimsy and feels like it's going to snap in half when the wet ...
customer_reviews.text: We've had Swiffer's well, for as long as I can remember. The quality has definitely diminished. I needed something to mop the floor in my dorm, so I got this. It is very flimsy and feels like it's going to snap in half when the wet mopping pads are attached. The Swiffer that I have home, and the one at my grandfather's house are not this flimsy!
customer_reviews.author: NW96

customer_reviews.title: Mop head can not hold the cloth in place
customer_reviews.text: Mop head can not hold the cloth in place because of the mechanism it uses. It uses four tiny plastic clips to hold the cloth, but it's neither strong enough to hold the cloth nor durable for long term use. instead I recommend buying another product which uses Velcro:
customer_reviews.author: C. Lu

customer_reviews.title: Only good for small restroom
customer_reviews.text: It's a wonderful idea to clean and dispose of the towel, Clean, easy especially if you have a small area to clean. However, this wet sheet does not work. It is soaked with cleaning solution. you actually wet one small area so wet that the solution goes between the wood flank and nothing left for the rest of the floor. This is good for like a small bathrroom with tile.
customer_reviews.author: Milo

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in this new Swiffer mop I ordered here recently. Unlike my old one (which thank goodness I didn't throw out), this one is cheap and flimsy and flops back when I try to push it across the floor! My old one is weighty and clings to the floor when pushed along. Can't understand why they changed it! Buyer beware! I seriously want to let the makers beware of this problem or they will go out of business for not listening to their customers. This item needs to be reengineered!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E. Estes

customer_reviews.title: Leave it up to Swiffer
customer_reviews.text: I have used Swiffer for years and after moving to our new home, we had to get another one. It's much more flexible to use compared to the conventional broom with brushes. The cotton pad can pick up most small dirt and debris from hardwood floors or in our case, ceramic tiled floor. The handle has a good amount of length and it's very flexible cleaning hard to reach angles.
customer_reviews.author: HF

customer_reviews.title: Dont bother customers and consumers with this product
customer_reviews.text: Does not i repeat does not hold cloths in place because of the clips it uses ..they should have gone with a rotation mechanism or slide in or a sticking on mechanism so many different productive ways for the cloth to stay on instead they use clips poorly thought out in all honesty waste of time and money spent
customer_reviews.author: geraldcompany

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting those dust bunnies underneath the bed
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't live without my Swiffer, works great on the hardwood floors. The dry cloths really pick up the dirt and all the pieces of crud brought in the house on the bottom of my shoes, even though I try to only wear "house shoes" when inside. I like that the bottom is hinged allowing you to push the Swiffer under thin spaces. I no longer use it wet, but it works just as well wet as dry.
customer_reviews.author: goldenlvrTop Contributor: Quilting

customer_reviews.title: Material quality has dropped, but still does the job
customer_reviews.text: Swiffer has definitely started to skimp on the quality, the material is different than it was years ago. More brittle and I can see the bottom will quickly wear out soon. The aluminum pole has also weakened. I used to swat tennis balls with this couple years ago and that just left some dents on it. I think this recent ones will break after just one swat, it looks that fragile. But it does it's job... I don't know how long it will last though... Shouldn't of used the old one to hit those tennis balls :/ I deeply regret
customer_reviews.author: Koala_Shin

customer_reviews.title: Don't get this if fragrance makes you sick
customer_reviews.text: The description lists both the wet and dry wipes as unscented. The dry ones are, but the wet wipes are very fragrant. So much perfume is used. Just a heads up for other people with fragrance sensitivities. I had to throw them out. The dry ones are great. I can use my unscented floor cleaner with them. The swiffer functions well, but I'm giving it low stars for inaccurately listing this as a scent free product, which is really irresponsible and potentially harmful for other folks who share my disability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: (Un)Satisfaction Guaranteed
customer_reviews.text: I’m so disappointed in this. The sweeper comes in parts which I assembled, only to realize that the handle piece is missing a peg, so there is no way to attach it to the next section. I’m not sending it back because it’s a waste of time to do so, but seriously, I expected a working product with all the parts to it. I could make it work with a screw or tape or something, but that’s not the point. I paid for this thing. I attached pictures or all 4 sections.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Alice

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: This product saved me - I have arthritis in my back and knee's, and normal mopping and ringing out were such a chore and pain to my joints. The Swifter is so easy, no bending, no rinsing out, no ringing. I just put a wet pad on, run it over the floors, and they come out clean. When the pad get dirty, you just change it. I recommend this great product to every one if they want a truly clean floor with no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Paolucci

customer_reviews.title: Useless Swiffer
customer_reviews.text: I don’t get how this product has such positive reviews. The wet pads couldn’t stay on whenever I move the swiffer. It’s really useless. Don’t buy. It’s a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Good for small area touch ups.
customer_reviews.text: It kinda just smears the dust around if you try to run it around the whole floor. It works best to just sweep the hard floor normally and use the wet pads as touch up for the spot where you broom into the dustpan and never seem to be able to get that last line of dust up! Also nice for getting into corners here and there where excess dust always seems to want to stick. Limited functionality, but sparked up small spots nicely as long as you don't make my mistake attempting to use it as a duster for the whole floor and just get dry dust lines instead of the loose dust that was there.
customer_reviews.author: Kassia Toth

customer_reviews.title: Great product & amazing price
customer_reviews.text: This is just what you'd expect: a nice little mop! Comes with the entire handle, mop, and a few cleaning pads to get you started. I love this thing! I also am usually too cheap to buy the actual swiffer brand wet wipes. I usually buy the dry Swiffer towels, wipe up the dust and stuff with those, then just attach a Clorox Wipe to the bottom when I want to do wet mopping. You can continue to spray your floor with cleaner as you make your way around & then the mop will stay wet. This way you can save a lot by not purchasing the Swiffer wet wipes but still mop your floor!
customer_reviews.author: Lexie

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT ITEM FOR MANY REASONS FOR A SMALL PRICE
customer_reviews.text: Super item. I was going to get a patent on a similar idea years ago. I was just going to have paper towels of any brand with the standard size be up to the buyer and therefore not force them into having to buy specific absorption items. But this item can use paper towels and the excellent replacements made for a much better cleaning process. This is only not perfect when you have to use a standard mop or towels to clean spills. Otherwise you can use it as a flat broom and then a cleaner on wood or non carpet floors. So inexpensive and able to get under super small places. Yes to the Swifter.
customer_reviews.author: Major T.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pet hair and light mopping.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as a replacement for my very old Swiffer that got broken during my move. The Swiffer makes cleaning up pet hair quick and easy--the pet hair seems to gravitate towards the cloth. If I've dropped something crumbly, I still get out my broom and dustpan, since the Swiffer seems less effective for those textures. The mop function is nice, too. It's good for a quick clean if your floor isn't too soiled. Since I have no kids in the house and I don't live in a muddy area, it suits my purposed perfectly. If your floor needs a serious scrubbing, you would probably need something sturdier than this mop.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed little tabs to hold mop pad in place bent and not holding after just a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and have barely used it and the plastic mop pad holders are already bent and not holding the mop or dust pads. This swifter mop is poorly designed. Do not waste a dime.
customer_reviews.author: USA review

customer_reviews.title: Kind of disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This mop was labeled as replacing a broom. I was excited to not have to sweep my floors, but I still have to with this. The dry pads are basically dry cloths for dusting the floor. I was surprised that it picked up some hair, but did not pick up all the dirt. I guess I would use this after sweeping with a broom to pick up dust left behind. After that, the wet pads are pretty nice to deeper clean the floor. Not a bad price for a starter set, but it's nothing fancy. Not looking forward to paying for replacement clothes; I wish there were resuable and earth-friendly alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Will not replace vacuum cleaner but effective and easy for quick touch ups on uncrowded floors!
customer_reviews.text: Greatly improved from my original Swiffer! Larger surface with rubber pad helps dry cleaners stick better. Also, dry papers are textured and do great job of picking up pet fur on uncarpeted areas. Wet mopping pads are ok but honestly expect to use diy solutions for both dry and wet due to cost/waste of disposables. I like that this is quite light weight and easily maneuvered, a plus with my chronic back problems and klutz tendencies!
customer_reviews.author: a customer

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the ‘older model’ vs the new model. Don’t know what the difference is but I had broken my previous one so I need another fast. This came quick in its very own little Swiffer UPS box. It’s the same Swiffer I’ve always had. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Surf1974

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my dorm room!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to purchase the Swiffer after my friends highly recommended it. I have wood floors and the dry sweeping pads go perfectly with some Pine-Sol. It picks up the dirt, dust, and hairs off the floor. My room stayed nice and clean :D It's super easy to assemble, deconstruct/collapse, and takes up little to no room to store it. Definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: For my PET OWNERS!! READ!!!
customer_reviews.text: Pros:If you have a pet that sheds this is the way to go! I don’t know why I waited so long to get one thinking it was useless. It’s much easier than a mop and doesn’t give that “Mop” smell. Before I had to sweep TWICE just to get half of what my dog sheds and when I would mop I still would see dog hair everywhere! When I used the swifter I definitely seen a difference. It’s a thumbs up for me for just picking up the hair. Cons: does not deep clean just something to quickly clean your floors. I keep a mop just in case and the swifter still gives off a scent.(unsure of the scent)
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing with microfiber pads!
customer_reviews.text: I used to be skeptical of swiffer a until I became a professional cleaner. This works better than a mop. I use microfiber reusable pads which I purchased here on amazon as well. I treat this the same as a mop. Soak squeeze and clean. Washable pads are wayyyyy better than regular swiffer pads.
customer_reviews.author: Convcorta

customer_reviews.title: Great mop/broom system.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my first apartment and it works wonderfully. Very easy to assemble out a box. This is really just a wonderful mop system especially if you don’t have a ton of space for him up in my bucket. Also great for sweeping your floors especially if you’re mostly getting dust Up rather than large particles of anything. Bought this for my first apartment and it works wonderfully. Very easy to assemble it out of box. This is really just a wonderful mop system especially if you don’t have space for a mop and mop bucket. Also great for sweeping your floors especially mostly getting dust up of anything.
customer_reviews.author: E Frye

customer_reviews.title: I’m a big fan.
customer_reviews.text: This is replacing my very old version that got regalated to the ground floor. It was semi retired. I use the wet pads and find that using the dry pad to finish after wet, picks up more dirt. I can’t stand a sticky dirty kitchen floor. This does the trick and I’ve been using it since it first hitting the market. I previously owned the versions that sprays liquid cleaner onto the floor from an attached tank, but had eventual problems with the spray skewing in an odd manner. Love how it’s easy to maneuver behind the toilet. Remember those old yarn/ homemade rag mops that we had to squeeze by hand to get clean?
customer_reviews.author: TUTU

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed, I could cry! This is far from what I expected. I got it today and will be mailing it back tomorrow. I tried one of the wet cloths and it was horrible. I eventually dissembled the thing, put it back in the box and decided to write this review. Please don't waste your money. I am very, very disappointed, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Hot Rayven

customer_reviews.title: A great floor mop for home use
customer_reviews.text: My mother, once she tried it, loves using it to clean her floor. Instead of buying wet or dry towelettes refill from Swiffer, we buy a pack of kitchen wipes from 99 Cent Store. There are a dozen in a pack, reusable, easy to clean, and can be dry or wet It is like dryer sheets without the chemical, perfect to latch onto Swiffer.
customer_reviews.author: Anony MouseTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't live up to expectations
customer_reviews.text: I guess I was mislead by TV advertising to expect this product to actually be useful. I bought this mainly to clean up pet hair accumulations from the floor of my home office to save the bother of digging out and setting up the vacuum cleaner for a brief use. I believed the swiffer pad covers would attract and hold the "dust bunnies" but it just pushed them around and did not pick them up at all. For my needs and the purpose for which I bought it I find it pretty much worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K. Houseman

customer_reviews.title: It Paid for Itself at my House
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together and I was in business in perhaps three minutes. Since I have flexibility issues, I can now clean corners better and get under low furniture and under radiators with this item. There is a ball that allows the rectangular pad to swivel so that you can make the most of the pad's dimensions. The cleaning products do not last long - it is, after all, only a starter kit - but it is a good way to try their cleaning products. I use my Swiffer on hardwood floors, stone tile, and linoleum with good results.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela M. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Great job with hardly moving a finger
customer_reviews.text: I've never used this before but I really like it. I used the dry swiffer sweeper 1st and it picked up all the dirt & hair. Then the wet mop swiffer cleaned up ground in dirt. I'm used to working much harder at getting the floors clean. I really enjoyed barely moving it along the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Dena Hollowell

customer_reviews.title: Great Design...love it
customer_reviews.text: I use this mop with Quick shine. Instead of using the pads that came with it I attach a wash cloth to it instead. So all I would have to do after Quik shining my wooden floors...is wash the cloth for reuse. I use the Amazon Basics wash clothes with this mop which saves me money. I love how this mop is manufactured, it allows you to attach any regular wash cloth size cloth to the mop.
customer_reviews.author: Truth289

customer_reviews.title: Good solution poor, cheap applicator!
customer_reviews.text: Like the cleaning solution, pads are VERY costly. The pole ,stick ,handle, is INCREDIBLY cheaply made. Breaks very easily and the pop up buttons to put it together, didn't! They had to be fished out of the interior. Poor Quality control on the manufacturing??? M. Nino
customer_reviews.author: Melinda J. Nino

customer_reviews.title: A necessity!
customer_reviews.text: Great for picking up hair and dust off the ground! I use the swiffer to pick all that up, then come in with my broom and sweep up the leftover crumbs/larger particles that the swiffer isn’t made to pick up. My only complaint is that the wet pads aren’t wet enough to mop my whole kitchen (and I don’t have that big of a kitchen). I had to use two out of three pads that my order came with. I guess that’s how they they get you to purchase more of their products!
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use Sweeper and Mop
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy it was to put together and used the sweeper to pick up dirt. The mop was great, used one side and then turned to sheet over to scrub the floor again. The floor looks so clean, thanks! 8-17-19 I use a microfiber cloth with a binder clip on top on each side to attach the ends. First to sweep, then remove the cloth. Add another cloth (clipped on top) soaked in vinegar, a couple drops dawn soap to mop the floor. This saves on buying refills and the microfiber towels can be handwashed or thrown into the washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Sticky floors
customer_reviews.text: So, the swifter leaves my hardwood floors feeling very sticky, although beyond that, it cleaned up a dried soda spill in seconds! Not a lot of scrubbing involved it cleaned my floors really well. I wish it didn’t leave my floors sticky or I would continue to use this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff McKee

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!  Not a good purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the wet refills. It’s frustrating and useless. There is no accommodation for keeping the refill on the Swiffer mop so the damn thing falls off. I tried pinning it but it still comes off when rinsing or pushing it the long way. The Swiffer flips when you are trying to clean. It wastes so much time and energy. Plus it makes me angry!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: You need one of these
customer_reviews.text: I love my swiffer! This was bought as a replacement. I've been using a swifter since the early 2000's and I love the simplicity of it. I often use my own cloths with it and toss them in the wash but the swiffer wet wipes are handy. The dry cloths are great for a quick going over and it's amazing what they pick up.I really wish these had been around in the 90's when my kids were small and I wouldn't have wasted so much time rinsing out mops.
customer_reviews.author: Linda H

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Convenient!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love how easy this is to use for the wet mop. Makes it look like I worked really hard scrubbing my floors. Also makes my house smell like I have been cleaning! I use on my hard wood floors only after using on tile so the pad dries off. Not for deep cleaning but great if you have dogs who shed!!! Took off a star: I filled a spray bottle with water and a little Murphy's Oil Soap because the pads dry out too fast. Love this product!! Makes my life easier.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do light mopping around my house. Our home is 3100 square feet. This mop is NOT meant to clean my size home. The mop is very small. I went through 20 of the pads to clean 75% of my house. They dried up so quickly, only a few swipes until I would have to switch out for a new one. I wish the mop itself and pads were larger. Sure, it's easy to switch them. But very wasteful and inefficient. If you have a very small area, they would work ok.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get the big stuff
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use in our camper. I figured it was small enough to stay out of the way and would help keep the floors clean (can you say 4 young kids). I used this every evening to "sweep", it did pick up the dirt and attracted some grass that made it in, but won't pick up sand or small rock particles. I used this to "sweep" everything to the door then one of the kids got the sand out. I will buying a hand dustpan and hand broom to use with this to get the bigger particles once they are in a pile.
customer_reviews.author: SamB

customer_reviews.title: Old Swiffer is better...
customer_reviews.text: On my old Swiffer, the handle sections screwed together and it felt solid; the new one, not so much. I thought I could just swap out the mop heads but this new pad feels more like foam than rubber and the seams (where the bottom part of the pad meets the part that overlaps onto the head) don't feel very strong. I'm going to return this new one and just use some duct tape and fix my old one. What a bummer!
customer_reviews.author: GraDe

customer_reviews.title: Missing piece rendered this junk
customer_reviews.text: It is frustrating when quality control. Just doesn’t control quality. Missing piece to the wand rendered this useless.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning dorm/small spaces!
customer_reviews.text: Great all-in-one for cleaning a dorm room floor! I love how it comes in a small, portable box and you can easily assemble/dis-assemble the pole (it comes in parts, which again helps with space+portability). I wouldn’t recommend it for deep cleaning or big spaces tbh because the cloths are pretty small and thin, but it’s great for generally cleaning small spaces. Also, you can use Clorox/any cleaning wipes in place of the wet cloths if you ever run out! (& another review I read they just used wet paper towels)
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Great when you dont want to have to mop. And want to do it in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: These are great when you just want to mop the floors to get all of the dust, dirt, and other things that have stuck to the floors. I also use these on my walls. Since I live to a large dirt field, we have a good amount of dirt that blows into our house and sticks to EVERYTHING. Including, our walls. So, I use these to clean all of the dirt that sticks on the walls. They are great because the arm lets you get up high, and the chemicals dont take off paint.
customer_reviews.author: fatguyinalilcoat

customer_reviews.title: I soon realized how bad it is for the environment
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. But when I started using it, I soon realized how bad it is for the environment, with the need to keep replacing the sheets for a little spill or dusty floor, when you can do the same with a cloth you can use over and over. It's basically a wet tissue with a stick. Consider that before paying the price.
customer_reviews.author: CamillaRose

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool, I have two little dogs and cleaning my tile flooring is easy and swift, without having to drag a bucket and mop around, getting into corners. I specially like that it collects a the hair and it's not getting tangled in the mop or spreading it around👍🙋🏼‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: CHO

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: I realize that I'm getting old and not the brightest light in the room any more, but how the heck hard can it be to get the wet and dry attachments to stay on? Based on everything I can find I am correctly attaching the wet sheet, getting it into the "slots" yet the second I try mopping they fall off. This is a piece of junk and I'll never buy another Swiffer product again. Back to the old mop and bucket for me.
customer_reviews.author: C. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: A useless product
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to mop the floor in my apartment but I had to use 3 wet pads and I live on a small studio. The wet cloth is dry after 4-5 sweeps and needs to be changed. You spend more time changing and reversing cloths than cleaning and above all it is too expensive to constantly keep buying cloths.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Novev

customer_reviews.title: Wet wipes will not last for entire house
customer_reviews.text: It’s light, easy to use. I don’t like the lock for wipes, it’s kind of uncomfortable. I love the scent of wet wipes, but to clean floors in my house I will need at least 2 wet wipes. It’s ~1800sqft and we have only 30% without carpet, but one still not enough and they not cheap. But overall I’m happy with this mop, because it’s comfortable and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Desertsnow

customer_reviews.title: It's Swiffer, It's Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Swiffer is great for routine cleaning of hardwood surfaces and kitchen/bathroom tile. Obviously I would not use a Swiffer for any type of deep-cleaning, but for routine cleaning, this is an excellent alternative to the old mop and bucket. It has a pleasant scent, and it is easy to remove the cleaning pads when I am finished. Everyone needs one, so just stop shopping around and buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Sir E.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This does the job for small spaces. I used it for my kitchen and bathroom and I definitely could’ve used 2 wet pads. Towards the end, it wasn’t giving off as much product as I would’ve liked. I also found that every time I tried mopping in forward and backward motions, the mop would flip up. Rather, I found myself having to put it back and forth using the width of the mop. I wish this set came with more than 3 wet pads. Other than that, it gets the job down.
customer_reviews.author: Haley Szoszorek

customer_reviews.title: not so helpful
customer_reviews.text: this product does not clean as well as the pads do and you cannot use too much force or the wil slip and tear. Did not work for my kitchen however not say that it would work on a different type of surface
customer_reviews.author: Kylie Franko

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable set to try everything out
customer_reviews.text: These are great for cleaning hardwood floors and for trying out the wet and dry wipes. I use the wet wipes on the bathroom floor and the dry wipes with some Bona hardwood cleaner for the rest of the house. Once my dry wipes run out, I'll be switching over to reusable Swiffer pads for less waste. Great set and much easier on the back and knees when cleaning floors.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie T

customer_reviews.title: Good product overall. Need some improvements.
customer_reviews.text: I love this wet/dry mop. The dry pads pick up so much dust, hair, dirt. The wet pads do NOT stay wet long enough for even a small room is why this product doesn't get 5 stars. In fact. I would deduct 2 stars for that reason alone, but the dry pads make up for this complaint. I use a squirt and mop product to extend the life and cleaning area of one pad. I wish they could make the pads a tad thicker to hold more cleaning solution. Otherwise I love how lightweight it is and the ease of use. Perfect for walls, ceilings and ceiling fans when using the dry pads also.
customer_reviews.author: Tama Para

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit
customer_reviews.text: This starter kit is so cheap it’s hard to talk badly about it. I think it does a great job, but you definitely have to let whatever is on your floor soak and then dig in with your weight into the swiffer to realllly clean up messes. The deep cleaning isn’t as easy to do as they claim but overall it’s an amazing price for what it does
customer_reviews.author: Kento

customer_reviews.title: Great For Small, Quick Clean-Up
customer_reviews.text: We have a Motorhome with linoleum tile floor. Between parking in State Parks where forest-dirt gets tracked in and oceanfront campgrounds where sand filters in, this cleaning kit is easy to use and does a decent job of keeping the floors under control. There is a notice my review was “hidden” due to some sensitivity filter. I must be insensitive as I see no reason to hide my review?
customer_reviews.author: Kokomo

customer_reviews.title: Good Addition to Cleaning Tools
customer_reviews.text: My last Swiffer Sweeper wore out, so I'm back again for another one. As always, the Swiffer is useful. But I have cats and it doesn't do so well when trying to catch those wispy fur-balls that float away with the slightest movement of air. The kit comes with a few wet mop sheets that I could not use because they are highly scented.
customer_reviews.author: 3Catzzz

customer_reviews.title: Fairly sturdy, good quality!
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy it was to put together and how it picks dirt up rather than pushing it around. I used this product on my hardwood and I have absolutely no complaints. I used the dry first and then mopped with the wet one. This product completely cleaned my floors in the best way possible, they are almost shining. It's awesome. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle C

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I had a new floor installed last month and a Swiffer was recommended for cleaning it. It is a cheap design and cheaply made (in China). The handle is uncomfortable to hold and is too short (I am 5' 6"). Wet pads start out sopping wet but dry out very quickly. Each wet pad is only good for about 25 sf of cleaning surface. The 'cleaning strip' is worthless. The dry pads will pick up dust but that is about it. Dry pads are probably good for about 100 sf. The sponge mop, dust mop or even string mop in your closet is a far superior product.
customer_reviews.author: zscore

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: This really isn’t practical. It doesn’t pick up dirt and just pushes it around. The wet pads dry after a few strokes. Very unsatisfied with the product and feel ripped off. I have hard wood laminate and this is a horrible way to try and clean them. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Abe S.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: It is just what I needed. These have been around for years but this was the first time I decided to give it a shot. It works well for small kitchen and bathroom areas. I imagine for larger areas it would be necessary to use more than one wet refill. Great deal all around.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Dont know why it is so popular
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small apartment and my room has carpet floor so I needed it for my kitchen and livingroom but one pad doesn't even last for my small kitchen. If you go to dollar shop, they have exactly the same thing with way lower price.... plus, doesn't even really clean thing...
customer_reviews.author: J K.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It is very handy for a quick clean up but not idea for deep clean. The refill packs are a bit pricey but you can buy refills from cheaper brands with similar size. Or, you can use a thin micro fiber cloth with a mini binder click (clipped to the holes) to hold it in place for both dry and wet clean if you don’t mind to wash it after use.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy JST

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, durable, good price
customer_reviews.text: We really like this product as it is lightweight, durable, inexpensive and can very flexible in turning. We use microfiber cloths instead of disposable swiffer cloths and it has worked well. omOur swiffel lasted almost 10 years before we have to replace it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony W

customer_reviews.title: Convenient + Great for Apartment Living
customer_reviews.text: Our apartment is mostly carpet, but our bathrooms and kitchen are tile. I thought this would be a great product to have on hand for weekly cleaning. I am pleased with both the dry and the wet pads and it works well on our tile floors. When there are sauces or various things stuck on the tile, it isn't very easy to scrub the gunk off, so I usually have to get down on the ground to get it up. Other than that, this is a very handy tool to have and it fits in our pantry nicely and isn't bulky. I recommend it - especially for apartment living!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Going

customer_reviews.title: Meh. - I need to re-wet the wet wipes. Not the sturdiest.
customer_reviews.text: The dry wipes are a useless unless it's only dust you are after. The metal rod is not very strong. Light cleaning only. Wet wipes don't cover much area before they dry out. I still love the concept of being able to mop with a clean smelling disposable material without bending down - just need a sturdier solution.
customer_reviews.author: Ani Natekar

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: When this box arrived I figured they had forgotten to send the stick. I was amazed to see that the stick was actually 3 metal pieces that all fit together. It put together just fine and I have had no issues. I wanted something smaller and lightweight to carry in my vintage travel trailer and this fit my needs exactly.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Best way to clean my wood floors!
customer_reviews.text: My only quibble is that the aluminum pole of the handle is a bit flimsy. I managed to break it about once every year or two, forcing me to buy a new starter kit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael V. Raffety

customer_reviews.title: Corners
customer_reviews.text: Great for open floor but i did notice it had some trouble in corners or near the wall there's abt a half inch space that it can't seem to get. This could very well be because my apartment is old and the floor isnt completely level. Other than that its a great tool for my laminate flooring!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I can't say how it works on hardwood floors since I don't have any, but it does work for a quick clean up on tile floor. I don't think it would be good for a deep cleaning up if you just want to quick clean up or touch up the floor it works good. I like the smell too.
customer_reviews.author: Bensen

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit for everything you need
customer_reviews.text: great price for the entire kit. I buy the refills from target (in-house brand) and those are slightly thinner but get the job done. Yes, the brand's original refills are the best but if you are on a budget others will fit just get this starter kit. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SV

customer_reviews.title: Love my swiffer
customer_reviews.text: I love my swifter. Use it for hardwood floors and it’s super easy to use and gets them clean quick. Plus it’s lightweight. This one is all you need too, I don’t need the fancy wet jet one. This one does the job!
customer_reviews.author: T.Hoover

customer_reviews.title: cleans, but leaves a strong odor
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time to clean my kitchen and hallway floors which are tiled. It was easy and quick to use and got my dirty floor clean, but it leaves a strong odor that lasted for almost 24 hours. It must leave a residue on the floor. There should be some way to rinse. Next time I use it I'm going to go over the floor with a clean wet cloth or paper towels to get up the residue and odor. this is just my opinion. It was recommended to me by my niece, who loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Adler

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the purchase of the Swiffer Sweeper starter kit.
customer_reviews.text: Instead of unpacking and dragging all over the apartment my 40-lb vacuum cleaner, I get to clean every two-three days with ease. I purchased the dry and wet mop refills. No complaints. Very happy with the purchase of the Swiffer Sweeper mop refills and the starter kit.
customer_reviews.author: Shady Character

customer_reviews.title: Terrific starter kit
customer_reviews.text: I've used Swiffer before but finally bought one for myself. The price is right on this starter it. Comes in a small box and it clicks together so easily and stays together. I'll most certainly be using generic refills because of price-- but this name brand starter works great.
customer_reviews.author: T. Layne

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Assemble, Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Swiffer has changed the way that I clean my kitchen, bathroom and any non-carpet surface within the home. Brooms and dustpans can leave that last bit of dust behind that drives you crazy, but Swiffers don't leave any of that behind. This pack comes complete with anything and everything that you need for its first few uses. There are only a few cleaning pads included, perfect for giving it a test run before committing to more. Easy to assemble and even easier to use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Horwitz

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My husband is not a fan of cleaning, but he loves to use our Swiffer mop. Takes very little time to clean and you can really see the difference. I also like that the refills aren't too expensive. Great alternative to a traditional string mop!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great for mopping with ease
customer_reviews.text: Love my swifter it’s so easy to use and so much better then filling up a bucket to mop with. I still sweep with a regular broom first bc my floors get so messy from kids n pets. But over all the wet mop part of it is amazing and the main reason I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: The head of the mop wants to flip and flop, and when there is a wet pad on it, the pad really really loves to come right off of the mop. You’d do better to use cleaning wipes and just rub them on the floor. The whole family of Swiffer items that I purchased just went into my garbage. There are bound to be plenty of its kinfolks at the landfill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy & Effective
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to assemble, use, and clean. Very light yet effective and I love it. I use it in my kitchen and bathroom in my apartment and sometimes my roommates borrow it too and it’s been pretty handy to use. I wouldn’t say I’ve really used it for deep-cleaning though, just simple maintenance cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: how did i live without this?
customer_reviews.text: I have used these in my clients homes and finally got one for myself. I love it. If you use it regularly, it does a very good cleaning job. However, if you have a really tough stain, you may need to use a little more 'elbow grease'.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: First Swiffer I’ve owned
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that all I’ve heard about the Swiffer sweeper was hype. I finally decided to purchase the starter kit. After the first use that evening I ordered more dry and wet pads. Extremely easy to use and cleans the floor much better than a broom.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Love this for a quick and thorough clean
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to put together and I tried the dry cloth first. I think the dry clothes are great if you haven't sweeped in a long time. I then went over with the wet cloth and that was very long lasting. I did my living room, kitchen, and bathroom all with one cloth and it stayed wet and picked up dirt the whole time. I would only but the wet cloths for replacements.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Useful, with a few quibbles
customer_reviews.text: It's quite useful, especially when used with the dry cloth. I couldn't get the wet cloths to stay attached (haven't developed the right technique yet, I guess) and the first time I opened a wet-cloth package, all the liquid inside spilled all over me. Now I know to open them over the sink!
customer_reviews.author: TermiteWriter

customer_reviews.title: Replaced old swifter
customer_reviews.text: Old swifter broke after twenty years plus and we ordered this new one. Tried and true product to keep floors clean. Especially like using on our old hardwood floors. Service was great and price was lower than if purchased in store.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: SO EASY~
customer_reviews.text: I have seen these forever. I always had real hardwood floors and now I have laminate in my beach condo. This does the trick and so fast! No having to get the vacuum out or anything just Swiffer the floors, and under all the furniture is so easy and dust buster the mess and done! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: KarenWasHere

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for my old Swiffer that we had for years. This is a great product that is super easy to use! I haven’t tried it on our hardwood floors but I love using it on our bathroom tiles. I also like that it is easy to store and does not take up a lot of room.
customer_reviews.author: Soki Kim

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, so easy and inexpensive. If you don't want to spend the extra money on the wet/dry wipes... Go to the dollar store!
customer_reviews.author: Naturalistichealth

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Good deal for the pack. The swiffer wet pads are nice for my hardwood. Don’t really see the use of the dry ones. Doesn’t change direction super easy, sometimes it flips itself, but overall does well. Can’t really do a deep clean, this is more used for a daily mop.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Handle bar pieces were not right
customer_reviews.text: THe 4 pieces of metal bars did not connect properly. One piece had a faulty button that did not fit in any of the other bars, hence the handle of the duster became unusable. Being this was a gift, the defect (which Amazon would have probably heard and know of already from other Swiffer buyers) was not found out till late and thus outside of return window.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvio T.

customer_reviews.title: Great, cheap, easy to use mop.
customer_reviews.text: Use one of these at work so already knew what I was buying, it is easy to use and can fit just about anything on the pad I buy the walmart brand wet wipes and they work perfectly. I also use cleaning cloths with floor cleaner that also work when the floors need some scrubbing. Bought this to replace my old cedar mop that was just way too huge and I like the option of using my own cloths or the wet wipes or dry on the swiffer, all in all it is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Meygan Paige

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, nothing special.
customer_reviews.text: It seems okay. The quality isn't super high, but you get what you pay for. The wet wipes run out of moisture pretty easily, so I stick mine in the sink and wet it again. I plan to purchase a reusable pad and a spray bottle to do my hard floors in the future. You can get them at like Walmart or HEB...
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Does the work but not the best
customer_reviews.text: This mop does the work but sometimes it can get hard to use it. The wet wipes are too wet in the beginning and hard to insert in. Other than that, it does what it is supposed to. It comes with few wet and the dry wipes . AFter that, you have to buy the refills.
customer_reviews.author: Monima

customer_reviews.title: The most BRILLIANT invention of all time
customer_reviews.text: Love how compact this 2 in 1 sweeper and mopper is! Very good quality! The sweeper is very effective in getting rid of hairs on the floor. The wet mopping sheet smells really good and smartly designed to clean all different kinds of surfaces. Extremely satisfied with such a brilliant invention! Thank you, Amazon for the speedy delivery and good quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Kay Oh

customer_reviews.title: So/so
customer_reviews.text: I love how light weight it is and it gets in between spaces where a mop wouldn’t be able to. What I don’t like about it is that the wet cloths dry out easily as you’re mopping. I can get my kitchen floors but by the time I get to my dining room, the wet cloth already seems dry and needs to be replaced. I live in an apartment too so it’s not that big.
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great for picking up pet hair
customer_reviews.text: I loved the Swifter! You can really tell a huge difference after you use the Swifter Sweeper. I could actually feel the floor was clean when I walked on them barefoot. The floors look like they were mopped with a mop and no dust particles were left behind.
customer_reviews.author: TB

product_meta.title: Swiffer Sweeper Cleaner Dry and Wet Mop Starter Kit for Cleaning Hardwood and Floors, Includes: 1 Mop, 7 Dry Cloths, 3 Wet Cloths
product_meta.description: Style:OLD Sweeper Starter KitWith a one-two cleaning punch, Swiffer Sweeper is designed to sweep and mop your floors. Thick dry sweeping cloths conform to the surface of your floors and grout lines, trapping and locking dirt. Wet mopping cloths dissolve dirt and grime for good, trapping it in its core and locking it away. Do not use Swiffer Sweeper wet cloths on unfinished, oiled, or waxed wooden boards, non-sealed tiles or carpeted floors. Some assembly required. A mopping pad consisting of an absorbent core made of cellulose and polyester fibers, which holds the cleaning solution, sandwiched between a soft polypropylene nowowoven floor sheet and back sheet.
feature_bullets: Starter Kit Includes: 1 Sweeper Mop, 7 Dry Cloths, 3 Wet Cloths
Sweeper Dry Deep textured ridges TRAP + LOCK dirt, dust, hair & allergens common inanimate allergens from cat and dog dander & dust mite matter
Sweeper Wet Textured mopping pad cloths TRAP + LOCK dirt deep in cloth. Scrubbing Strip removes tough spots
